lines.text: Your generation grew up, married, raised families, went to war. But nothing happened to you, Bill. You just got older.
You worked a whole day just to dance a minute at Dream Land?
It was worth it.

[Looks Bill over]
The name is Cay... when you get bored.
Quick on the trigger, aren't you?

[Angrily]
What do you mean by that?

[Smiles]
Simmer down, you'll live longer.
I came to New York from up state. I was gonna be a dancer. I was a brunette. Started on my toes and wound up on my heels.
Nobody'll ever put me in a stinking cage again.
That's up to you son. It's not going to be easy. The average person outside won't accept you, Bill. Won't hire you. Won't trust you. You won't even have a vote.

[Looking at the clock]
You're talking on my time, warden. It's 8 am.
And for your own good. Good luck.

[Dancing with a customer]
You need a little practice, honey.
Yeah.

[Amorously]
A few private lessons will fix that.
[Bill squeezes her]
Ooh, not so tight, honey.

[the music stops and she lets go of him]
That's it?
What do you expect for a dime?

[Bill clumsily dances with Cay]
You can't dance. What did you come up here for?
To meet somebody.

[Releasing his clutch]
I don't give private lessons.
My name is Clark. Bill Clark.
Nice to meet you, mister.
[Holds up a drink]
Here's mud in your eye.

[Holds her hand]
You... you know you got me all wrong.
Let's not make a big thing out of it.
I just wanted to meet somebody.

[Plays up to him]
So you like me, huh?
I'd like to know you better.
One way is to spread a little joy around.
[Bill doesn't get her drift]
Joy. Little presents.
What kind of presents?
That's up to you and how much you like me.

[Referring to the city]
I've never been here before.

[Cynically]
You can get a sightseeing tour for a buck.
A lot of things have changed out there.
A lot of us have changed in here too.
You came in here when you were 13 years old. That means you've been here...
18 years, 3 months and 6 days.
What time do you get through here?
There's a house rule against dating customers.
Do you always stick to the rules?
Yes, my own.
